title: House of the Dragon: What we know about the Games of Thrones spin-off
description: The series is set 200 years before Game of Thrones - but the dragons, death and feuds are all there.

title: Paid leave for premature births aims to be a relief for parents
description: A new law would give parents with babies in neonatal units up to an extra 12 weeks of paid leave.

title: Cost of living: Saving money on our summer holiday
description: Millions of us are still determined to have a summer getaway but keeping an eye on spending.

title: Jamie T on his a six-year silence, oligarchs, and Kim Jong-Un
description: After an absence of six years, indie hero Jamie T is back with a new album, and plenty to say.

title: 'Why I cut homeless people's hair for free'
description: Wisdom Oviawe, 22, has been offering his services to homeless people in Nottingham city centre.

title: Cuba protests: Mothers' trauma over harsh jail sentences
description: Many young people received long jail terms after participating in last year's anti-government protests.

title: Climate change: How to talk to a denier
description: Tips about how to engage with people who think climate change is a "hoax".

title: ‘A group of builders changed our lives’
description: Volunteer builders carried out a home extension for a man with a debilitating neurological condition.

title: Pope Francis: The pontiff's 'pilgrimage of penance' to Canada
description: Pope Francis will meet with indigenous communities to apologise for the church's role in residential schools.

title: Chatsworth's hidden 17th Century garden revealed in drone footage
description: The recent heatwave has parched grass lying over a formal garden, which dates back to 1699.

title: France 1-0 Netherlands: Eve Perisset scores extra-time winner from the spot
description: France "are here to build history" after beating the Netherlands in extra time to reach the Euro 2022 semi-finals, says boss Corinne Diacre.

title: Lucy Bronze: 'I learned a lot from 2019 World Cup heartache'
description: Lucy Bronze was at the peak of her career in 2019 so when England lost to the USA in the World Cup semi-final it hit her hard.

title: Frankie Boyle questions existence of cancel culture
description: People who claim to be silenced never seem to go away, the comedian observes at the Latitude Festival.

title: Dog Surfing Championships take place at Poole's Branksome Dene Chine
description: Pooches are riding the waves onto Branksome Dene Chine beach, hoping to take the title of top dog.

title: Ukraine war: Explosions rock Ukrainian port hours after grain deal
description: Six blasts hit Odesa on Saturday morning, with local officials blaming a Russian missile attack.

title: Lord of the Rings: Prequel trailer wows fans as it reveals rare female dwarf
description: The Rings of Power, Amazon Prime's Lord of the Rings spin-off, is the costliest TV show to date.

title: French Grand Prix: Carlos Sainz to start at back as Max Verstappen fastest in FP3
description: Ferrari's Carlos Sainz will start the French Grand Prix from the back of the grid as a result of penalties for excessive engine usage.

title: Tory leadership: Rishi Sunak says massive NHS backlog is national emergency
description: The Tory leadership candidate wants to cut hospital waiting times and improve diagnostic services.

title: Clacton: Body found in search for 21-year-old swimmer
description: Essex Police seeks to contact the family of a missing 21-year-old swimmer after a body is found.

title: Gianluca Scamacca: West Ham agree £30.5m deal for Sassuolo and Italy striker
description: West Ham agree a £30.5m deal with Sassuolo for striker Gianluca Scamacca.

title: Commonwealth Games 2022: Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce, Gretel Bueta, Samu Kerevi among stars to watch
description: Olympic medals, world titles, social media millions and a hill named in their honour. Meet some of the world superstars descending on Birmingham for the Commonwealth Games.

title: WWE chief McMahon retires amid sexual misconduct allegations
description: Vince McMahon led the wrestling firm for decades but this year faced sexual misconduct allegations.

title: Giant Lovell radio telescope at Jodrell Bank to become space light show
description: The giant Lovell radio telescope at Jodrell Bank is transformed into a space-themed light and sound show.

title: Tamara Ecclestone heist: Serbia refuses to extradite £26m raid suspect
description: Court documents obtained by the BBC show the Met applied to extradite him from Serbia last spring.

title: The Latitude Festival-goers stockpiling to save money
description: As inflation bites, music lovers share money-saving tips, while one trader fears making a loss.

title: Wildlife photography: Magic of Skomer's puffins captured
description: As puffin breeding season draws to a close, Drew Buckley shares his photos of the birds.

title: Sydney McLaughlin shatters 400m hurdles record to win gold
description: American Sydney McLaughlin breaks her own world record by almost three-quarters of a second to take 400m hurdles gold in Eugene

title: World Athletics Championships: Matthew Hudson-Smith wins bronze in 400 metres
description: Watch as Great Britain's Matthew Hudson-Smith wins bronze in the men's 400m final with USA's Michael Norman taking gold and Grenada's Kirani James winning silver at the World Athletics Championships in Oregon, USA.

title: World Athletics Championships: Matt Hudson-Smith wins 400m bronze to add to GB haul
description: Great Britain's Matt Hudson-Smith wins his World Championships medal, claiming 400m bronze with a gutsy run in Eugene.

title: World Athletics Championships: Sydney McLaughlin smashes world record in 400m hurdles
description: Watch as Sydney McLaughlin wins gold and smashes the world record in 400m hurdles final in an unbelievable 50.68 seconds.

title: Blake Lemoine: Google fires engineer who said AI tech has feelings
description: Blake Lemoine went public with his beliefs that Google's breakthrough Lamda technology is sentient.

title: Latitude Festival: Lewis Capaldi says he's 'too lazy' for new album
description: "I just want to say now, I have no new music," says the star as he headlines the Latitude Festival.
